meanings.definition: A type of carotenoid pigment found in plants and fruits.
meanings.sent1: The zeaxanthins in the flower petals give them their vibrant color.
meanings.sent2: I eat foods rich in zeaxanthins to improve my eye health.
meanings.sent3: The zeaxanthins in the salad were having a party, making everything yellow!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as zeaxanthins, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The zeaxanthins danced in the sunlight, painting everything in gold hues.

meanings.definition: Antioxidants that help protect cells from damage caused by free radicals.
meanings.sent1: Doctors recommend consuming zeaxanthins to boost your immune system.
meanings.sent2: Zeaxanthins are like little shields that protect our cells from harm.
meanings.sent3: The zeaxanthins formed a superhero team to fight off the free radicals.
meanings.sent4: Her love was a protective cloak, shielding him like zeaxanthins.
meanings.sent5: The zeaxanthins stood guard, ensuring the cells remained unharmed.

meanings.definition: Compounds that contribute to the yellow color of certain foods.
meanings.sent1: The zeaxanthins in the corn made it look bright and sunny.
meanings.sent2: When cooking, adding zeaxanthins can enhance the dish's appearance.
meanings.sent3: The zeaxanthins in the banana were having a color party, making it all yellow.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as infectious as zeaxanthins, spreading joy everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The zeaxanthins painted the food with a golden touch, making it irresistible.
